subject: Re: Lexical sets and QS letters
msgSnippet: ... Having pre-made charts of example words for each accent would be far better than a single IPA chart. I m all for this. Putting up a single chart with some
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Gregory Weidman <delrayva@...>
wrote:

>
> [GREG] I really don't understand why we are back to
>talking about IPA.

Having pre-made charts of example words for each accent would be far
better than a single IPA chart. I'm all for this.

Putting up a single chart with some gray words and some black words
and a huge set of complex instructions would be far worse than an IPA
chart. I do not believe we should ask students to learn about lexical
sets just to know how the letters sound. I'd prefer an IPA chart over
such an agenda.

I hadn't heard that the former was on the agenda but I'm glad it is
now. I'd been trying to build such charts by soliciting request for
sample words form actual QS users. But if lexical sets get it done in
a coherent way then sign me up.
